message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.DS, cs.NE 

This paper deals with the problem of automated machine learning, which involves selecting appropriate algorithms and optimizing their hyper-parameters for certain learning tasks. This problem is relevant to several sub-fields of computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), computer vision (cs.CV), data structures and algorithms (cs.DS), and neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE). Given the focus on optimization and algorithm selection, cs.LG and cs.AI are the most likely sub-categories, followed by cs.CV due to the potential applications in image and video analysis. The use of Bayesian optimization and combinatorial bandit problems also suggests a connection to cs.DS and cs.NE.
